de.engehausen.treemap.mat.impl
Class ColorMatcher

java.lang.Object
  de.engehausen.treemap.mat.impl.ColorMatcher

public class ColorMatcher
extends java.lang.Object

Color matcher used to match string to RGB (color) instances. This class is used for the preferences and the actual run time of a tree map pane at the same time.
It is somewhat string based, since all rules and colors need to be stored in a single string in the preferences.

Nested Class Summary
static class ColorMatcher.ColorElement
          Color element describing a pattern/sub-string and color.

Parameters:

getElements

public java.util.List<ColorMatcher.ColorElement> getElements()
Returns all color elements the matcher holds.

Returns:
the color elements of the matcher, never null.

from

public static ColorMatcher from(java.lang.String str)
Creates a color matcher from its string representation. The format of the string is:
  1. default-color
  2. color - pattern - isRegExp
  3. ...
The separator used is the tab character (\t).

Parameters:
str - the string representation of the color matcher.
Returns:
a color matcher, never null.

to

public static java.lang.String to(ColorMatcher matcher)
Converts a given color matcher into the format document in its counter-method from(String).

Parameters:
matcher - the matcher to turn into a string
Returns:
the string description of the matcher, never null.

match

public RGB match(java.lang.String string)
Matches the given string against the first matching ColorMatcher.ColorElement in the list of color elements. If none match, the default color is returned.

Parameters:
string - the string to match; must not be null.
Returns:
the matching color, never null.
